Embers of Yesterday::
A balladeer cries out of the night
 
 Tells his tale of woe
 
 His own true love has found another and he's left all alone
 
 So weep awhile for those denied their heart's sweet embrace
 
 But don't ask why it is, don't ask what was
 
 It just is 'til it isn't anymore
 
 
 
 One by one the restless voices whisper in the dark
 
 Long in shadows who have only words that light no fire
 
 Do they speak to someone who can answer, someone they can trust
 
 Anything that I may know I will fly far
 
 All it holds me is chains weighs me down
 
 And it just is 'til it isn't anymore
 
 
 
 Chapter closed and forgotten, embers of yesterday
 
 Whatever I believed was of so little consequence
 
 As I walk a land so empty, walls come tumbling down
 
 Cannot escape the burden of someone who went before
 
 I don't think I even care now
 
 'Cause it just is 'til it isn't anymore
 
 
 
 All the answers seem so distant, faces faint
 
 Still I can't forget the quest that none would want to make
 
 The days that we expected were a destination set
 
 The paths that we were following were not the ones we chose
 
 But the changes we discovered, the answers that we found
 
 Dreams turned into artifacts
 
 And we just believed in them 'til they quietly collected dust and shadows fell to dust
 
 
 
 Walk on, walk on in silence
 
 Don't you weep for someone
 
 It just is 'til it isn't anymore
 
 Chapter closed and book forsaken
 
 Read on by no one
 
 Embers of yesterday
 
 None but most returned
 
 To tell of battles, never lighting fires
 
 Do they climb like ruby stones
 
 Upon rings with bones in silence
 
 One by one

 Where the thrush unbinds his hours;

 He “Best” have pet copy handy

 in his wildest tumbling-floor tumult

 Did he bring her easter flowers did she bring her a stem ‘o ’are? 
 With half-a-taken-war . . . 
 
 The Gulf-flood-swamps of tamed misery 
 
 Between his departed-merits 
 In the delvish sea-home where unpatterned and dehumiliable

 With tales of conquest that won’t never spoil 
 Never invite unrest and projection too . . .

Dancing with the Stars::
Shall I leave them by your gate

Or, sad one, at your shrine?

Shall I leave them there, my dear,

Your little dancing shoes?

They have touched the hand of youth

And have known the ways of love.

The laces stir with the strings of life

Still they can, away from you.



Shall I leave them by your gate

Or, sad one, at your shrine?

Rain has filled the heel and sole

And washed away the tie.

I'll not leave them by the gate.

I'll not leave them at your shrine.

The soul must fly where the soul belongs,

I have no right to stay.

Please excuse me, well, I may be wrong

It should matter just to you.

Shall I leave them by your gate

You understand me now.

In the Heart of the Storm::

I hold you close but I hear her sing

Through the Eyes of Time::
Years ago a young man came to this house

He was thirty-two years old and nothing hung in the sky

But small black flags from different lands after the storm



Inside the house he’d bring you back so many things

It wasn’t much, wasn’t much a friend would bring

Nothing but the clothes he wore, no dog or bird

No money to run free, nothing much to free his mind

Just by a window

It was a room so very small no bed was in it

There was a bible on a stand beside me in a winding sheet



He heard of a wealthy merchant in this town

Who must have seen the devil in him, a stranger in this land

A stranger in this time



To him no more the present meant

It was the gift to live the future and the past

To him no more the moment near, was anything

That will ever last



Then one day he thought that he might not be well

But yet been a friend and been to hell

And if for some strange reason he could make amends

Would he. . . would he make good. . .



He purchased thirty cracked hands and fifteen winter coats

For the future had told him that there would be much needed!



For fathers and for sons and for sisters

And for daughters, and their mothers standing in their grief –

And for the kindness of mankind, the future will look kindly

On those in dire need, they come a-knocking in the night

And their numbers may grow by amounts you never think of



As he opened the door and turned away to the light

He was about to step outside

He heard a voice whisper to him –

“Come in, come on! We can’t wait for you like you do

For us, we see through the eyes of Time.”



He wasted not a hard breath in throwing himself out

Against the sights and sounds and the smells of the street

He ran so fast and cried out loud

Into the circumambient cloud

“Help from above, Lord, give me strength!

To keep on livin’

In the face of death”



His head grew heavy and his lips turned blue

And the corpse walked to the waters

Closed their doors on him and flew

To the other side



As the sun went down and as the night went by

The madman’s soul went flying free

Into the firmament of time and light

So come with me, O! come with me and we shall book a room

With a double bed and window on high

We can dance on the side of the volcano beneath the moon

And we shall dance until the night becomes a brand new day,

And the words that pour from our lips shall be heard by one and all



Through the eyes of time
